Package com.guardsquare.dexguard.runtime.detection

Class EmulatorDetector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.guardsquare.dexguard.runtime.detection.EmulatorDetector
  • public class EmulatorDetector
extends java.lang.Object
    The EmulatorDetector class bundles various emulator detection techniques.

    Attackers will often attempt to run sensitive applications in emulated environments. Emulators provide complete control of the environment which results in a whole range of inspection techniques useful for reverse engineering the application.

    Because the attacker has complete control it is very hard to correctly detect these kinds of tricks from the application level. Our techniques try to detect emulators together with any attempts at tampering with the actual detection. We provide some configuration flags to control how strict these checks are.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int FAIL_ON_MITIGATED_TAMPER_ATTEMPT
      Fail the test anyway on averted tampering attempts.
      static int IGNORE_TAMPER_ATTEMPTS
      Ignore any signs of tampering and just take into account what the actual checks indicated for the emulator tests.
      static long lastCheckTime
      Static fields used to cache the result of the emulator detector detection The generated code relies on this
      static EmulatorDetectorReport lastReport

    • Method Detail

      • isRunningInEmulator

        public static int isRunningInEmulator​(android.content.Context context,
                                      int ok,
                                      int flags)
        This method will use a series of techniques in order to determine if the application is running in an emulator or on a real device.
        Parameters:
        context - Application context.
        ok - Return code indicating no emulator was found.
        flags - Flags enabling some configuration of the employed checks.
        Returns:
        Returns 'ok' if not on an emulator, a variation of 'ok' containing an error code when an emulator was detected.

      • isRunningInEmulatorInternal

        public static EmulatorDetectorReport isRunningInEmulatorInternal​(android.content.Context context,
                                                                 int ok,
                                                                 int flags)
        This method will use a series of techniques in order to determine if the application is running in an emulator or on a real device.
        Parameters:
        context - Application context.
        ok - Return code indicating no emulator was found.
        flags - Flags enabling some configuration of the employed checks.
        Returns:
        EmulatorDetectorReport contain information collected by the EmulatorDetector.

      • isRunningInEmulator

        public static int isRunningInEmulator​(android.content.Context context,
                                      int ok)
        Convenience wrapper around the more elaborate isRunningInEmulator(context, ok ,flags) method.
        Parameters:
        context - Application context.
        Returns:
        Returns the value passed to ok if no emulator was detected.

      • isRunningInEmulator

        public static int isRunningInEmulator​(android.content.Context context)
        Convenience wrapper around the more elaborate isRunningInEmulator(context, ok ,flags) method.
        Parameters:
        context - Application context.
        Returns:
        Returns 0 if no emulator was detected.
